pageContext.claim: “They [Canada and Mexico] have made such great deals, both of the countries, but in particular, Mexico, that I don’t think we can make a deal.”
pageContext.analysis: The United States is running a trade surplus with Canada. The trade deficit with Mexico is distorted by trade in crude oil and petroleum products. If these products are excluded from the trade balance, the deficit with NAFTA partners has been lower than the overall deficit in some years, according to the Congressional Research Service.
